Package wiffleballScorekeeper.menu

Class MainMenu

java.lang.Object
wiffleballScorekeeper.menu.Menu
wiffleballScorekeeper.menu.MainMenu
public class MainMenu extends Menu
This MainMenu class is used to control an instance of the main WiffleballScorekeeper class. It inherits from the abstract base Menu class, and is used to get and process input it from the user.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • MainMenu

      public MainMenu(WiffleballScorekeeper scorekeeperApp)
      Initializes an instance that will be used to control the given WiffleballScorekeeper instance. The parent constructor from Menu is used to create the options to start a new game or quit.
      Parameters:
      scorekeeperApp - Instance of WiffleballScorekeeper for which this Menu should serve as a controller.

  • Method Details

    • display

      protected void display()
      Overides the base Menu class' display method to include the title of this menu.
      Overrides:
      display in class Menu

    • processInput

      protected void processInput(char input)
      Implements the abstract processInput(char) function which is used to control this MainMenu's WiffleballScorekeeper instance based on the user's choices.
      Specified by:
      processInput in class Menu
      Parameters:
      input - Character indicating the key for which option the user has selected. This option should always be valid.

    • run

      public void run()
      Main loop used to get input from the user. Displays the menu, and then gets and processes the user's input using the overriden processInput(char) method. The loop is continued until the user selects quit. This loop clears the console before each prompt, creating the effect that the menu is stationary and rather than scrolling.
